column4: would anyone be able to help me out with some graphics issues in ubuntu?
I am unable to read a few lines at the bottom of my screen for some reason
I had issues like that, and found I had scrolled up and didn't notice.
it does it every time without me doing anything... and I cannot scroll down
I just tried that
I don't see that card listed under supported video cards.
sorry its GeForce4 MX 4000
its in the list
Or try this line sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg if the other stuff don't work.
hehe i already restarted =P
FurryNemesis, sehute: any ideas as to what I do now?
had done the stuff found at the video hardware howtos you get when you ask bot about nvidia.
yeah they didnt work
Xlib: extension "GLX" missing on display":0.0".
it says xserver-org postinst warning: ovewriting possibly-customised configuration file; backup in ....
Do you by chance have an older computer that has shadow ram, or one that also has an enabled onboard video?
nope its fairly new
why?
I tried that already... didnt work
Im just reinstalling ubuntu
